1.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

2.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

3.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
rescue (literal or figurative, persons, national or spiritual)

4.brief: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)

5.brief: happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

6.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

7.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
food (for man or beast), especially bread, or grain (for making it)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to jump, i.e. be violently agitated; causatively, to terrify, shake off, untie
to yoke or hitch; by analogy, to fasten in any sense, to join battle

8.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to open (the senses, especially the eyes); figuratively, to be observant
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

9.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, a guest; by implication, a foreigner
a widow; also a desolate place
to duplicate or repeat; by implication, to protest, testify (as by reiteration); intensively, to encompass, restore (as a sort of reduplication)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

10.brief: to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
